what: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: Use R query Open Source Vulnerability (OSV) database. can useful cross check database packages used requirements.txt (python) renv.lock files (R). generated content can also used create block lists curated repositories Posit Package Manager. details OSV project associated API can found : https://google.github.io/osv.dev/

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: can install {rosv} GitHub:

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: One simplest queries provide package ecosystem return TRUE/FALSE response informing package ever listed vulnerability.
code: library(rosv)  is_pkg_vulnerable(c('dask', 'dash'), ecosystem = c('PyPI', 'PyPI'), cache = TRUE) #>  dask  dash  #>  TRUE FALSE

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: basic usage {rosv} pull versions PyPI CRAN packages listed OSV database using high-level functions osv_query() create_osv_list().
code: # Query one package in PyPI for vulnerabilities pkg_vul <- osv_query('dask', ecosystem = 'PyPI') create_osv_list(pkg_vul) # Pull the entire set of PyPI vulnerability data pypi_vul <- create_osv_list(ecosystem = 'PyPI') pypi_vul

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: Lower-level functionality available return details API request response contained within R6 object. flexible higher-level alternatives. default, results functions cached using {memoise}. can overriden specifying cache = FALSE.
code: # Returns entire response object to parse as you please. osv_query_1('dask', ecosystem = 'PyPI')  # Returns the vulnerability IDs for packages in list osv_querybatch('dask', ecosystem = 'PyPI')  # Return vulnerabilities from different ecosystems as vectors osv_querybatch(c('dask', 'readxl'), ecosystem = c('PyPI', 'CRAN'))  # Grab details by vulns ID osv_vulns('PYSEC-2021-387')  # Clear cache, if needed clear_osv_cache()

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: using product {miniCRAN} Posit Package Manager, may corporate requirements limit packages users can install. Although whitelist often recommended, either specify exact versions approved exclude packages known vulnerabilities. Given amount packages versions, often difficult. following method take vector packages (PyPI) cross-reference OSV database. packages identified either entirely dropped, specific versions flagged vulnerabilities excluded.
code: # List of packages of interest python_pkg <- c('dask', 'tensorflow', 'keras')  # Create the xref whitelist pypi_vul <- create_osv_list(as.data.frame = TRUE) xref_pkg_list <- create_ppm_xref_whitelist(python_pkg, pypi_vul)  # Output requirements.txt which can be used with PPM product writeLines(xref_pkg_list, 'requirements.txt')

title: Client to Access and Operate on the Open Source Vulnerability API
text: {rosv} still young project. plans extend use. Currently uses R6 classes lower-level interface OSV API. Pagination functionality added offered {httr2}, time writing available experimental. also plans types returned details, returning just version input functions like osv_query().

'arg' should be one of “AlmaLinux”, “AlmaLinux:8”, “AlmaLinux:9”, “Alpine”, “Alpine:v3.10”, “Alpine:v3.11”, “Alpine:v3.12”, “Alpine:v3.13”, “Alpine:v3.14”, “Alpine:v3.15”, “Alpine:v3.16”, “Alpine:v3.17”, “Alpine:v3.18”, “Alpine:v3.2”, “Alpine:v3.3”, “Alpine:v3.4”, “Alpine:v3.5”, “Alpine:v3.6”, “Alpine:v3.7”, “Alpine:v3.8”, “Alpine:v3.9”, “Android”, “Bitnami”, “CRAN”, “Debian”, “Debian:10”, “Debian:11”, “Debian:12”, “Debian:3.0”, “Debian:3.1”, “Debian:4.0”, “Debian:5.0”, “Debian:6.0”, “Debian:7”, “Debian:8”, “Debian:9”, “GSD”, “GitHub”, “Actions”, “Go”, “Hackage”, “Hex”, “Linux”, “Maven”, “NuGet”, “OSS-Fuzz”, “Packagist”, “Pub”, “PyPI”, “Rocky”, “Linux:8”, “Linux:9”, “RubyGems”, “SwiftURL”, “UVI”, “crates.io”, “npm”

title: Create list of packages identified in OSV database — create_osv_list
text: rosv_query table vulnerabilities created via query_osv; NA pull entire database based upon ecosystem parameter. ecosystem Character value either 'PyPI' 'CRAN'. delim deliminator separate package version details. .data.frame Boolean value determine data.frame created instead list. refresh Force refresh cache grab latest details OSV databases. clear_cache Boolean value, force clearing existing cache upon exiting function.

title: Create list of packages identified in OSV database — create_osv_list
text: vector object containing package version details; .data.frame selected vector reformatted data.frame object.

title: Create list of packages identified in OSV database — create_osv_list
text: core calculation extract details database. , set future::plan() parallelization, respected via furrr package. default run sequentially. NOTE: Currently, returns packages just subset using query approach (packages vulnerability found). May require subset returned.

title: Create list of packages identified in OSV database — create_osv_list
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  pypi_vul <- create_osv_list() file_name1 <- file.path(tempdir(), 'pypi_vul.csv') writeLines(pypi_vul, file_name1)  cran_vul <- create_osv_list(ecosystem = 'CRAN', delim = ',') file_name2 <- file.path(tempdir(), 'cran_vul.csv') writeLines(cran_vul, file_name2)  # Clean up try(unlink(c(file_name1, file_name2)))  # Use from query instead of entire database pkg_vul <- osv_query(c('dask', 'dash'), ecosystem = c('PyPI', 'PyPI')) create_osv_list(rosv_query = pkg_vul)  if (FALSE) { # In parallel future::plan(multisession, workers = 4) pypi_vul <- create_osv_list() future::plan(sequential) } }

title: Cross reference a whitelist of packages to a vulnerability database — create_ppm_xref_whitelist
text: packages Character vector package names. osv_list OSV data/list created create_osv_list. ecosystem Determine ecosystem OSV list used (currently works PyPI). delim delimiter used creating osv_list. version_placeholder Value used creating osv_list create_osv_list.

title: Cross reference a whitelist of packages to a vulnerability database — create_ppm_xref_whitelist
text: Character vector containing information selective requirements.txt file.

title: Cross reference a whitelist of packages to a vulnerability database — create_ppm_xref_whitelist
text: Note version suffixes may compatibility issues. example, use *-git suffix may recognized may need dropped. details PyPI package version naming see https://peps.python.org/pep-0440/. Due variations formatting API, responses versions associated directly compatible function.

title: Cross reference a whitelist of packages to a vulnerability database — create_ppm_xref_whitelist
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() python_pkg <- c('dask', 'tensorflow', 'keras') pypi_vul <- create_osv_list(as.data.frame = TRUE) xref_pkg_list <- create_ppm_xref_whitelist(python_pkg, pypi_vul) file_name <- file.path(tempdir(), 'requirements.txt') writeLines(xref_pkg_list, file_name)  # Clean up try(unlink(file_name)) }

what: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
title: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
text: connect OSV API query vulnerabilities specified packages. Unlike query functions, osv_query return content response object. default vulnerabilities returned versions package flagged OSV. can subset manually via parameter all_affected_versions.

title: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
code: osv_query(   name = NULL,   version = NULL,   ecosystem = NULL,   page_token = NULL,   all_affected_versions = TRUE,   ... )

title: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
text: name Name package(s). version Version package. ecosystem Ecosystem(s) package(s) lives within. page_token large number results, next response complete set requires page_token. all_affected_versions Boolean value, TRUE return versions found per vulnerability discovered. ... parameters pass nested functions.

title: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
text: Since 'query' 'batchquery' API endpoints different outputs, function align contents list vulnerabilities. 'query' meant flattening , 'batchquery' meant using IDs fetch additional vulnerability information flattening list.

title: Query OSV API for individual package vulnerabilities — osv_query
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # Single package pkg_vul <- osv_query('dask', ecosystem = 'PyPI')  # Batch query name_vec <- c('dask', 'dash') ecosystem_vec <- rep('PyPI', length(name_vec)) pkg_vul <- osv_query(name_vec, ecosystem = ecosystem_vec) }
